intro: Elatostema lushuiheense var. latibracteum, commonly known as the broad-bract elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. The plant produces tiny greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are often subtended by broad bracts. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. This variant is notable for its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
